description: Starts for strings of exactly 6 consecutive nonsquarefree numbers.
example: Squares dividing string started by 22020 are as follows:4,361,121,9,4,25 resp.
mathematica: Select[Range[400000], !SquareFreeQ[#] && !SquareFreeQ[#+1] && !SquareFreeQ[#+2] && !SquareFreeQ[#+3] && !SquareFreeQ[#+4] && !SquareFreeQ[#+5] && SquareFreeQ[#+6]&] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 30 2011 *)Flatten[Position[Partition[SquareFreeQ/@Range[60000],6,1],_?(Union[#] == {False}&),{1},Heads->False]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 24 2014 *)
crossrefs: The smallest members of such strings of length k are listed in A045882.
Cf. A001694 powerful numbers, A013929 not squarefree.
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: Definition corrected by _Donald S. McDonald_, Nov 07 2002
